class.name: AnimationNode
class.brief_description: Base class for [AnimationTree] nodes. Not related to scene nodes.
class.description: Base resource for [AnimationTree] nodes. In general, it's not used directly, but you can create custom ones with custom blending formulas. Inherit this when creating animation nodes mainly for use in [AnimationNodeBlendTree], otherwise [AnimationRootNode] should be used instead. You can access the time information as read-only parameter which is processed and stored in the previous frame for all nodes except [AnimationNodeOutput]. [b]Note:[/b] If multiple inputs exist in the [AnimationNode], which time information takes precedence depends on the type of [AnimationNode]. [codeblock] var current_length = $AnimationTree[parameters/AnimationNodeName/current_length] var current_position = $AnimationTree[parameters/AnimationNodeName/current_position] var current_delta = $AnimationTree[parameters/AnimationNodeName/current_delta] [/codeblock]

method.name: _get_caption
method.description: When inheriting from [AnimationRootNode], implement this virtual method to override the text caption for this animation node.

method.name: _get_child_by_name
method.description: When inheriting from [AnimationRootNode], implement this virtual method to return a child animation node by its [param name].

method.name: _get_child_nodes
method.description: When inheriting from [AnimationRootNode], implement this virtual method to return all child animation nodes in order as a [code]name: node[/code] dictionary.

method.name: _get_parameter_default_value
method.description: When inheriting from [AnimationRootNode], implement this virtual method to return the default value of a [param parameter]. Parameters are custom local memory used for your animation nodes, given a resource can be reused in multiple trees.

method.name: _get_parameter_list
method.description: When inheriting from [AnimationRootNode], implement this virtual method to return a list of the properties on this animation node. Parameters are custom local memory used for your animation nodes, given a resource can be reused in multiple trees. Format is similar to [method Object.get_property_list].

method.name: _has_filter
method.description: When inheriting from [AnimationRootNode], implement this virtual method to return whether the blend tree editor should display filter editing on this animation node.

method.name: _is_parameter_read_only
method.description: When inheriting from [AnimationRootNode], implement this virtual method to return whether the [param parameter] is read-only. Parameters are custom local memory used for your animation nodes, given a resource can be reused in multiple trees.

method.name: _process
method.deprecated: Currently this is mostly useless as there is a lack of many APIs to extend AnimationNode by GDScript. It is planned that a more flexible API using structures will be provided in the future.
method.description: When inheriting from [AnimationRootNode], implement this virtual method to run some code when this animation node is processed. The [param time] parameter is a relative delta, unless [param seek] is [code]true[/code], in which case it is absolute. Here, call the [method blend_input], [method blend_node] or [method blend_animation] functions. You can also use [method get_parameter] and [method set_parameter] to modify local memory. This function should return the delta.

method.name: add_input
method.description: Adds an input to the animation node. This is only useful for animation nodes created for use in an [AnimationNodeBlendTree]. If the addition fails, returns [code]false[/code].

method.name: blend_animation
method.description: Blend an animation by [param blend] amount (name must be valid in the linked [AnimationPlayer]). A [param time] and [param delta] may be passed, as well as whether [param seeked] happened. A [param looped_flag] is used by internal processing immediately after the loop. See also [enum Animation.LoopedFlag].

method.name: blend_input
method.description: Blend an input. This is only useful for animation nodes created for an [AnimationNodeBlendTree]. The [param time] parameter is a relative delta, unless [param seek] is [code]true[/code], in which case it is absolute. A filter mode may be optionally passed (see [enum FilterAction] for options).

method.name: blend_node
method.description: Blend another animation node (in case this animation node contains child animation nodes). This function is only useful if you inherit from [AnimationRootNode] instead, otherwise editors will not display your animation node for addition.

method.name: find_input
method.description: Returns the input index which corresponds to [param name]. If not found, returns [code]-1[/code].

method.name: get_input_count
method.description: Amount of inputs in this animation node, only useful for animation nodes that go into [AnimationNodeBlendTree].

method.name: get_input_name
method.description: Gets the name of an input by index.

method.name: get_parameter
method.description: Gets the value of a parameter. Parameters are custom local memory used for your animation nodes, given a resource can be reused in multiple trees.

method.name: is_path_filtered
method.description: Returns whether the given path is filtered.

method.name: remove_input
method.description: Removes an input, call this only when inactive.

method.name: set_filter_path
method.description: Adds or removes a path for the filter.

method.name: set_input_name
method.description: Sets the name of the input at the given [param input] index. If the setting fails, returns [code]false[/code].

method.name: set_parameter
method.description: Sets a custom parameter. These are used as local memory, because resources can be reused across the tree or scenes.

signal.name: animation_node_removed
signal.description: Emitted by nodes that inherit from this class and that have an internal tree when one of their animation nodes removes. The animation nodes that emit this signal are [AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D], [AnimationNodeBlendSpace2D], [AnimationNodeStateMachine], and [AnimationNodeBlendTree].

signal.name: animation_node_renamed
signal.description: Emitted by nodes that inherit from this class and that have an internal tree when one of their animation node names changes. The animation nodes that emit this signal are [AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D], [AnimationNodeBlendSpace2D], [AnimationNodeStateMachine], and [AnimationNodeBlendTree].

signal.name: tree_changed
signal.description: Emitted by nodes that inherit from this class and that have an internal tree when one of their animation nodes changes. The animation nodes that emit this signal are [AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D], [AnimationNodeBlendSpace2D], [AnimationNodeStateMachine], [AnimationNodeBlendTree] and [AnimationNodeTransition].
